questions.text: Which two heroes switched places near the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Barry/Oliver.

	Oliver Queen woke up in Barry's bed, and was served breakfast by Iris West Allen, Barry's wife. In her eyes, he was still Barry, but the viewers saw Steven Amell, who played Oliver. This was the second scene of the episode after the villain received a book from a bad guy from the future.  This is the first part of a three-part, three series crossover episode. It started with "The Flash" Season 5, Episode 9, and carried into "Arrow" and "Supergirl".  Characters from future spinoff shows "Batwoman" and "Superman & Lois"  appeared as well.

questions.text: What is hidden inside IVO Labs?
questions.explanation:
A.M.A.Z.O.

	The acronym stands for Anti-Metahuman Adaptive Zutonic Organism. It was an android build to fight against metahumans. IVO Labs is named after the comic character Anthony Ivo, who has appeared in the second season of "Arrow" played by Dylan Neal, this crossover episode was the first appearance on "The Flash" for the character, though he is only mentioned, along with the lab appearing in the episode.

questions.text: The Flash yelled "You have failed this city" at two would-be diamond thieves. Whose catchphrase is that?
questions.explanation:
Green Arrow.

	Since it was Oliver in the suit, he used his own catchphrase while trying to stop the diamond heist at IVO Labs. Cisco called him out on it not being his own line, but it didn't raise any red flags to people at that time.

questions.text: Which member of the good guys punched out another member of the team?
questions.explanation:
Ralph.

	After Ollie and Barry told Barry's team about them switching identities, no one believed them. Iris drugged Barry/Oliver, while Ralph punched Oliver/Barry in the face, knocking him out cold. They took both men back to Ray Palmer's lab until they could figure out what was wrong with them. They woke up in a cell, both handcuffed.

questions.text: In addition to the "Arrowverse" series shows, nearly every other version of DC Comics-based TV and movies were represented in this crossover event.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The theme song from "Smallville" played, and the set of the Kent farm from that series was shown, but the characters were from "Supergirl" which was part of the "Arrowverse" family of shows. The "Arrowverse" was a series of shows all executive produced by Greg Berlanti. The theme song from the show played briefly, as the Kent family farm was shown. The words "Smallville, Kansas Earth 38" appeared on the screen.

questions.text: Both the titular characters of "Batwoman" and what other "Arrowverse" spin-off debuted in this crossover?
options: Lois & Clark: The New Adventures of Superman
questions.explanation:
Superman & Lois.

	Of the options, only "Superman & Lois" is an "Arrowverse" show, the others are stand alone shows based on DC Comics.  Lois Lane made her appearance in the Smallville scene along with Clark/Superman and Kara/Supergirl. Lois is played by Elizabeth Tulloch in this show and the "Superman & Lois" spinoff. Lois and Clark were arguing about the merits of being a journalist. He joked about her making up a reason to travel to Argo City with Superman, and she made fun of him for reporting on his own exploits as Superman. Kate Kane/Batwoman didn't show up until the second part of the crossover, hence the question is focused on Lois, who debuted in this episode.

questions.text: What famous DC-Comics related city debuted in the Arrowverse in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Gotham City.

	In order to introduce Kate Kane/Batwoman, the characters were forced to travel to Gotham City for the first time in the history of the "Arrowverse". Greg Berlanti still isn't allowed to introduce Batman into the world, but they were allowed to use his city and secondary characters, hence the introduction of Kate Kane. She was played by Ruby Rose in this crossover and the first season of "Batwoman".

questions.text: Who followed Barry and Oliver to Earth-38?
questions.explanation:
Cisco Ramone.

	After the team decided that they believed Barry and Oliver that they had switched bodies, Cisco went to Kara's reality to bring them home to help combat A.M.A.Z.O. After a short scene, Supergirl and Superman decided to help as well.

questions.text: A.M.A.Z.O. was able to replicate the abilities of all of the heroes that faced it.
questions.explanation:
True.

	After a short flight, the robot was thought defeated but instead rose up. Superman tried to attack, but it used Flash's phasing abilities, then Superman's strength and the abilities of the others to in turn attack them.  Eventually, the heroes were able to outsmart the robot, but not before tearing up a large part of Central City.

questions.text: Usually the heroes were able to outsmart the robot, but not before tearing up a large part of Central City.
options: Absolutely none, it's a red herring
questions.explanation:
Ability to rewrite reality.

	John Deegan (played by  Jeremy Davies) was given the book in the opening of the episode. It is what caused Barry and Ollie to switch bodies.  Basically anything Deegan writes into the book, becomes reality.  The first scene was on Earth-90, which is the universe where the 1990 "Flash" TV series took place. That series had already been moved into the continuity of this series in previous episodes of the series.
